content: On August 25, 1992, the Atlanta Braves achieved a significant milestone when they completed a remarkable comeback against the San Diego Padres. Trailing 8-3 in the bottom of the ninth inning, the Braves rallied to score six runs, capped off by a game-winning three-run homer from David Justice. This thrilling victory underscored the team's resilience and was a key moment in their successful season, which ultimately led to an appearance in the World Series.
